clinical_study.brief_title: Cap Assisted Forward-Viewing Endoscope vs Side-Viewing Endoscope for Examination of Major Duodenal Papilla
clinical_study.official_title: Cap Assisted Forward-Viewing Endoscope vs Side-Viewing Endoscope for Examination of Major Duodenal Papilla

brief_summary.textblock: Examination of major duodenal papilla (MDP) using a standard forward-viewing esophagogastroduodenoscopy (S-EGD) is limited. Until now, side-viewing duodenoscope is the modality of choice to examine the MDP. Cap assisted esophagogastroduodenoscopy (CA-EGD) uses a cap fitted to the tip of the scope that can depress the mucosal folds and thus improve visualization and examination of MDP. The aim of this study is to compare CA-EGD to side*viewing duodenoscope for complete examination of MDP.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of complete visualisation of papilla duodeni major
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus
primary_outcome.description: complete visualization is defined by visualization of both proximal and distal ends together with the orifice of the papilla

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration needed to localize the papilla
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after intubation of the esophagus

arm_group.description: undergo initial cap assisted forward-viewing endoscope then side-viewing duodenoscope
undergo initial side-viewing duodenoscope then cap assisted forward-viewing endoscope

intervention.description: a cap fitted to the to top of the forward-viewing endoscope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- indication for elective upper endoscopy
- age over 18 years
- ability to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- surgically altered upper gastrointestinal tract
- known or suspected upper gastrointestinal strictures
- upper gastrointestinal bleeding
- biliary stent
- planned endoscopic intervention
- American Society of Anesthesiologists class III or higher
- contraindication for or refusal of sedation with Propofol
- inability to give informed consent
